summary: This is an agenda for a conference call between the FBI Victim Services Division and the Office of the Deputy Attorney General (ODAG) to coordinate logistics for a victim briefing related to the Epstein case. The agenda covers preparation of victim packets, RSVP issues, and travel arrangements for an event on November 11, 2020.

persons.name: Dr. Brooks
persons.context: Mentioned as a potential person to include resource materials in the victim briefing packets.

persons.name: Program Manager FBI Victim Services Division
persons.context: The author of the agenda, organizing the call to coordinate victim briefing logistics between the FBI and the Office of the Deputy Attorney General.

connections.person1: Program Manager FBI Victim Services Division
connections.description: The Program Manager suggests that Dr. Brooks could be asked to include resource materials in the victim briefing packets.

events.title: Epstein Victim Briefing/Event
events.description: An event or briefing for victims is scheduled, requiring coordination for travel, room blocks, and potential access to the Miami FBI Field Office.
personsInvolved: Program Manager FBI Victim Services Division

events.title: ODAG/FBI Epstein Briefing Coordination Call
events.description: A conference call to coordinate logistics for an upcoming Epstein victim briefing, covering packets, RSVPs, and travel.
personsInvolved: Program Manager FBI Victim Services Division

keyFacts: The FBI Victim Services Division and the Office of the Deputy Attorney General were coordinating a victim briefing related to the Epstein case as of late October 2020.
Logistical details for a November 11, 2020 event were being planned, including victim packets, travel, and potential access to the Miami FBI Field Office.
The document reveals ongoing post-conviction and post-death government coordination to provide services and information to victims of Jeffrey Epstein.
